snippet: Before a crowd of 2,300, Bill Clinton reprised much of the defense of President Obama’s first term that he delivered at the Democratic National Convention.
abstract: Bill Clinton takes the stage in Miami, Fla, before a sellout crowd of 2,300, reprising much of his detail-oriented defense of Pres Obama's policies at the Democratic convention; speech is first of several scheduled appearances in key battleground states for Clinton, who is embracing his role as Obama's highest-profile surrogate on the campaign trail.
lead_paragraph: Before a crowd of 2,300, Bill Clinton reprised much of the defense of President Obama’s first term that he delivered at the Democratic National Convention.

headline.seo: Clinton, Embracing Role as Surrogate, Hits Trail
headline.main: Embracing Role as Surrogate, Clinton Hits Campaign Trail
headline.print_headline: Embracing Role as Surrogate, Clinton Hits Campaign Trail
